abstract: Robert Serry, departing United Nations envoy for Middle East peace process, says Israeli settlements in Palestinian territories have eroded trust, and urges Security Council to step in and revive talks.
lead_paragraph: Robert Serry, the departing United Nations envoy for the Middle East peace process said that Israel’s policy of building settlements in the Palestinian territories “may kill” any chance of peace.

headline.main: U.N. Middle East Peace Envoy Urges Security Council to Revive Talks
headline.print_headline: U.N. Middle East Peace Envoy Urges Security Council to Revive Talks

snippet: Robert Serry, the departing United Nations envoy for the Middle East peace process said that Israel’s policy of building settlements in the Palestinian territories “may kill” any chance of peace.
